analytic.title: Some Aspects of Revaluation of John Cassian’s “De Incarnatione Domini contra Nestorium Libri VII”

biblStruct.note: "The results of theological research differ concerning the orthodoxy of [Nestorius] the Patriarch of Constantinople. It is well know that his "Liber Heraclidis" has thrown new light on what is called the "Nestorian Heresy". Many scholars have rehabilited Nestorius [...]. None of the great "Heretics" in the history of doctrine is carrying this name as unjustly as Nestorius. Hence Cassian is fighting a phantom because his arguments cannot hit the opponent. They are only a proof of his heavy prejudice. The seven books of D. I. ["De incarnatione Domini contra Nestorium"] therefore are not interesting for an eventual refutation of Nestorius. They are indeed an important document for the use of Scriptures of the Ancient Church in a christological controversy. In D. I. we have a harsh and total rejection of Nestorius." (pp. 21-22)
